components.description:
A locked (closed) padlock with an upright key at its right. Vendors implement the same designs as their üîí Locked and üîë Key.

May represent digital keys in public-key technology. May have similar applications as üîí Locked (privacy, security) and üîë Key (means of access, "crucial"). Sometimes used to represent a locket to symbolize romantic love and commitment.

Apple’s design previously featured the easter egg UM242 on its key, a reference to locks on Herman Miller office furniture. Facebook’s design once displayed a silver key, its head at the bottom.

This emoji does not display in page titles on Apple’s Safari web browser, presumably to prevent less reputable sites from pretending to be secure (encrypted using HTTPS).

Additionally, this emoji is not supported in Twitter / X names, to minimize confusion with private accounts on the platform. Learn more here.
components.title: Closed Lock with Key

title: Closed Lock with Key

version.description:
Released in October 2010, Unicode 6.0 was the first version of the Unicode Standard to support emoji.

Some characters in prior versions of Unicode were retroactively updated to provide an emoji presentation. This release was the first to introduce new characters for the sole purpose of compatability with emojis being used in Japan.

emoji_net_data.category: Miscellaneous Symbols And Pictographs -> User interface symbols

emoji_net_data.name: locked with key

bn:00109142a: Intended or adapted to afford protection of some kind

bn:00111923a: Closely constrained or constricted or constricting

bn:00099876a: Not open or affording passage or access

bn:00085162v: To close, to stop being open.
Move so that an opening or passage is obstructed; make shut
To move (a door, a window, etc.) so that it closes its opening.

bn:00091165v: To cause to open or to become open.
Cause to open or to become open

bn:00021525n: The ability of an individual or group to seclude themselves, or information about themselves
Privacy is the ability of an individual or group to seclude themselves, or information about themselves, and thereby express themselves selectively.
Concealment; the condition of being secret or hidden
Secrecy is the practice of hiding information from certain individuals or groups, perhaps while sharing it with other individuals.
The condition of being hidden or concealed
A customer's right to control how and to what extent their personal information is collected and used and with whom it is shared.
The condition of being concealed or hidden
The quality or condition of being secret or hidden
The ability of an individual or group to seclude themselves or information about themselves and thereby reveal themselves selectively.
Privacy is the ability of an individual or group to seclude themselves or information about themselves and thereby reveal themselves selectively.

bn:00033359n: In anthropology, kinship is the web of social relationships that form an important part of the lives of most humans in most societies, although its exact meanings even within this discipline are often debated.
(anthropology) relatedness or connection by blood or marriage or adoption
Kinship; being related by blood or marriage.
An archaeological relationship is the position in space and by implication, in time, of an object or context with respect to another.
The principle binding the most basic social units society. If two people are connected by circumstances of birth, they are said to be relatives
Relationship in space and time between archaeological objects or contexts
Relation or connection by blood, marriage or adoption.
Relation or connection by blood, marriage or adoption

bn:00060144n: A detachable lock; has a hinged shackle that can be passed through the staple of a hasp or the links in a chain and then snapped shut
Portable locks with a shackle that may be passed through an opening
Padlocks are portable locks with a shackle that may be passed through an opening to protect against unauthorized use, theft, vandalism, or harm.
A detachable lock that can be used to secure something by means of a sliding or hinged shackle

bn:00048985n: Metal device shaped in such a way that when it is inserted into the appropriate lock the lock's mechanism can be rotated
Instrument that is used to operate a lock
Device designed to open and close a lock.
A key is a device that is used to operate a lock.
An object designed to be able to open (and usually close) a lock.
An object designed to open and close a lock.
A device used to open a lock or door

bn:03153749n: Documentation for developers that describes specific security risks and how to avoid them when implementing Microsoft software.
Being protected against danger or loss (es)
Degree of resistance to, or protection from, harm
Security is the degree of resistance to, or protection from, harm.
Protection of a computer system and its data from harm or loss.

bn:00051771n: Something used for fastening, which can only be opened with a key or combination.
A fastener fitted to a door or drawer to keep it firmly closed
A lock is a mechanical or electronic fastening device that is released by a physical object, by supplying secret information, or by a combination thereof.
